alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 12 at 3:27AM PST until January 15 at 4:30PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting South Central Oregon Coast zone. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, the Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM PST Friday the stage was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 am PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Coquille River Coquille 21.0 19.8 Fri 2 am PST 18.3 21.0 21.1 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1130 AM PST.
